data.name: Elevator with call buttons
data.description:
There is a building with 4 levels. There is an elevator in that house and on every level there is a button to call the elevator. There are also buttons inside the elevator.

You have to program this elevator to go up or down,depending on what button the user touches,on what level was the call button touched and if the elevator is empty or not.


parameters:
'level' can be a number = 0,1,2,3
'button' can be a string = '0','1','2','3', //inside the elevator
                      'C0','C1','C2','C3' // call buttons, one on every level
'empty' can be a bool = true, false

return values can be numbers:
-3,-2,-1,0,1,2,3


TEST CASES:
1.If the elevator is on the ground floor(0th level) 
and the user in it touches button '2'
the elevator must go 2 levels up,
so our function must return 2.

2.If the elevator is on the 1st level and somebody is in it,
and the call button on the 3rd level is called (C3)
the elevator must remain on the 1st level,
so we must return 0.

3.If the elevator is on the 3rd level
and the user touches the call button on the floor (C0), 
and the elevator is empty,
the elevator must go 3 levels down, so our program must return -3.

4.If the elevator is on the 2nd level,
and the user touches button '2' or 'C2'
the elevator must remain on the same level,
no matter if it is empty or not.

5.We cannot endanger the lives of our passengers, 
so if we get erronous inputs, 
our elevator must remain on the same level.
So for example goto(2,'4',false) must return 0, because there is no button '4' in the elevator.
goto(4,'C0',true) must return 0, because there is no level 4.
goto(3,undefined,false) must return 0.
goto(undefined,'C2',true) must return 0.
goto([],'2',false) must return 0 because the type of the input level is array instead of a number.
goto(3,{},false) must return 0 because the type of the input button is object instead of a number.

HINT: You can use String.length to distinguish if a call button or a button inside the elevator was pushed.
